This issue includes:

- [ ] Hostname, ipv4, ipv6 tags are not supported. Related #169
- [ ] Inject and extract fail when using binary-map. Related #167
- [x] Peer.port is type of short, in some version of ot. Done in prev commits.
- [ ] Refactor codes about inject and extract when using text-map. #167
- [ ] Change context head-name to `sw3`. Lower case and shorter are better.

@xcaspar We just rename all the package, as we have the `skywalking.org` website in recent future. If you want to contribute any things about java codes, your better choice is to sync with `wu-sheng/sky-walking` first.

After I and @pengys5 discuss, the akka mailbox is in push mode, but in the other hand, disruptor is in pull mode. It is very hard to match these two.

But we all concern about jdk-queue, so decide use a new queue based on `AtomicInteger`, at least, have better performance.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/11298964/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/11298964)

Coverage remained the same at 71.192% when pulling **d77601b79339e6453368517e17e872d4eac63e59 on feature/181** into **340785a58df6198ef68682b8407644c78169a949 on master**.

1. The UUID what will happen when agent restarted. 
      (1) Use the preceding UUID. But that may pose a problem, how to discern the agent which is not changed? Use the information of server, like IP address, MAC Address,etc., but, if the agent running in container platform, when agent restarted, the server changed too.
      (2) Generate a new one. we want a timeout mechanism, insure that the stoped agent unable to show in UI.
  1. The UUID contains application code(A-UUID).
  1. The application code in trace segments instead of this integer id(instance-id).

cc @sky-walking

> The UUID what will happen when agent restarted.

@pengys5 `Happen` means `change`, I presume. You **CAN NOT** make sure the **ID** won't change at all circumstances. So in my proposal, I ask for a instance-id ( an integer ), for applicationCode + instanceId. 

This instance-id can be translated at collector-side, as an applicationCode and a instance-sequence.

But if you think translation at collector-side will cost too much (including memory and sync), we can set `instance-id = instance-sequence`.

The `the amount of instance` is determined by the trace segments, by distinct all instance-id in the time slice. The tricky question is `How you show the instance amount`?
@wu-sheng In my mind, the instance amount is the same as the relation between segment id and global trace id.
@pengys5 What is your meaning about **between**? These ids are changing at any moment. Like reboot an application, id_a disappear without any notice, and id_b begin to report.
@sky-walking Since this pr influence the development of other agent-related features, I will just wait another more 24hours, before merge.
Got it

Q: Why don't we generate instance id by instance environment? just like IP address, host name or service port.  Is send an integer can save more network?

In my mind. we can add instance-id to echo trace segment, and then send it to collector, We can use the start time and end time of each segment to analysis the agent which is up or down.

> We can use the start time and end time of each segment to analysis the agent which is up or down

You can know which agents are running, at least how many agents are running. But you definitely can not tell which is stopped. Because no trace segment didn't mean **stopped**, maybe the application is just a hot/backup instance node.

> Q: Why don't we generate instance id by instance environment? just like IP address, host name or service port. Is send an integer can save more network?

This is actually two questions.
1. `generate instance id by instance environment`, because in docker, can't guarantee any environment is different from others. 
1. `send an integer can save more network`, I think this is an improvement of performance. This is irrelative with instance-id.
@ascrutae #182 has been merged, please run tests on `master`.
@bai-yang The pr is closed a moment ago. Why?

Coverage decreased (-0.08%) to 71.204% when pulling **ca7f02caa380784118afd41095d0ba4d4aa70430 on bai-yang:master** into **e6ea5e11d07e4ed3c457a92e0af2c79053e2932c on wu-sheng:master**.
Why the coverage decrease?

Use restful service.

1. register service: The agent send the application code and jvm information to the collector server when agent start, data construct:
  request: `{"ac":"?","vm":{"?":"?"...}}`
  response: `{"ii":"instance id"}`

1. heartbeat service: The agent send the heartbeat data to the collector server every once in a while(undetermined time). The collector server mark the state of agent to stoped when collector server can not receive heartbeat data exceed the time limit, data construct:
  request: `{"ii":"instance id"}`
  response: `status code 200`
This PR has been tested.

Persistence data construct: 
index: instance_idx
record type: `"id":"instance id", "ac","application code", "st": "start time", "et": "last heartbeat time", "vm": {"?": "?" ..}`
index: inst_heart_idx
minute type: `"id":"instance id", "time_slice":"201705011907"`
hour type: `"id":"instance id", "time_slice":"201705011900"`
day type: `"id":"instance id", "time_slice":"201705010000"`
In my opinion, the check action need to execute before executing java command.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/11316048/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/11316048)

Coverage remained the same at 71.192% when pulling **39e414b6807f3b68dd79054059c11c57a370ca1e on xcaspar:feature/180** into **ecf7a2bf2a5c589525105b7727c0ef630e784978 on wu-sheng:master**.
@ascrutae why? The process is created by the java process, so it can only be checked after the java command.

> In my opinion, the check action need to execute before executing java command.

@ascrutae `Before` means run `java -version` to check the JRE version? Otherwise, how is this possible?

Your instance-discovery need base on a superposition algorithm. It is a little hard to find the amount of instances in a time slice.

Besides, your match mechanism seems impossible, because if instance-A running from t1 -> t1 + 10, at t1+12, instance-B and instance-C register both, you are impossible to tell `A = B` or ` A = C`, or neither.

Only choice is, basing on a superposition algorithm, in t1 -> t1 + 20, almost 2 instances are running.
Based on https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/pull/182#issuecomment-298318389, closing.
@pengys5 OK.
@xcaspar  I think I maybe miss you mind.  my purpose is that checking the previous pid of collector before start collector.
@ascrutae Do you propose to do the running status checking?
@wu-sheng  Yes.  that is my point
I hava just removed the `milestone` (3.1). After we agree to merge, I will set that again.
The wiki pages has been done! Close this issue
